title: would it be possible to buy an outside old judge for about $75
author: milkit1

posts.post_title: would it be possible to buy an outside old judge for about $75
posts.post_content:
I like the outdoor old judges and was wondering if I could get one for around $75? email me at [url]milkit1@gmail.com[/url]

thanks

With some patience, you can get an expectable OJ for around 75$ but it'll never happen if your going to limit yourself to an outdoor pose.  Most people like to get more then 30% value on their cards.

I'd recommend adding a another hundred dollars.  75$ OJs aren't even fun to own.  I've bought 3 of them for less then 75$ and instantly regretted it once they were in hand.  I do have one that I got for 80$, that I love, and plan to keep.
yeah i got one on ebay last winter for $60 tat was decent. Was hoping for some more luck :)

[quote name="milkit1" post=1003447]yeah i got one on ebay last winter for $60 tat was decent. Was hoping for some more luck :)[/QUOTE]

They are definitely out there, but you've got to have your finger on the trigger.  There's a guy snatching up every good BIN on the bay within minutes of listing.  It's gotten to the point where I feel like I have to buy first, then figure out if I really wanted it :)

I just got this one in the mail today, I love it.  I value it more then I paid:

[url]http://www.ebay.com/itm/221044350552?ssPageName=STRK:MEWNX:IT&_trksid=p3984.m1497.l2649#ht_1574wt_1072[/url]

Hi Matt!

thats a really nice one you picked up. yeah I try to stay away from the skinned ones and way trimmed ones. The outside ones are realyl cool to me in a creepy sort of way :)

I stay away from poor photo quality, that's my only requirement.  I don't mind a rebacked card.  I do mind a skinned one however, only because I don't really know how to reback it myself.

If your going to limit yourself to an outdoor pose that has not been altered, for $75, you might end up with a card you can't see :)
